title: Tracker and UI with version
body:
This PR adds `version` subcommand for `heron-tracker` and `heron-ui`.

The following commands are supported:

```
heron-tracker version
```

```
heron-ui version
```

I made one change that needs to be explained: [`zip_safe` is removed](https://github.com/twitter/heron/compare/master...objmagic:tracker-ui-with-version?expand=1#diff-96c1a009a7acd76ed67927c481c0ade4L32). Why? If this option is set to false, program will first be unzipped to `~/.pex` and then be executed. This means that [`get_heron_release_file`](https://github.com/twitter/heron/blob/master/heron/common/src/python/utils.py#L184) will fail to find release file. See [comment of `zip_safe`](https://pex.readthedocs.io/en/stable/_modules/pex/pex_info.html) for more details. I also want to know why `zip_safe` is set to `False` at first.

resolves #1155

title: heron executor refactor and unit tests
body:
This review includes refactorings with the following changes:
- Refactor methods to make `heron_executor.py` easier to unit test
- Adds unit tests!
- Adds functionality to allow the instance distribution to be dynamically updated, although currently it is still statically defined at startup.
- Some cleanup for pylint happiness

This change will put us in a much better place to add state manager watches on the instance distribution, once we're ready to do so.

title: Increase count of python method lines requires for a docstring
body:
Python doctsrings were required on all methods, which was strict and encouraged unnecessary 1-liner docstrings that only echo the method name. Increase the threshold to not require it for short methods.

Also cleaning up the overly verbose `statemanager.py`, which had more lines of comments than code, many of which were echoing well-named method names, or copy/pasted and incorrect.

title: Protect against failures when killing a running topology.
body:
I believe that this is functionally complete, I need to write some tests but wanted to get some feedback on the approach first.

If any of the state in zookeeper is deleted while others are left in
tact the topology will become undeployable because the cli will fail to
clean up the leftover state. The exception looks like:

```
[2016-07-21 13:42:23 +0000] com.twitter.heron.spi.statemgr.SchedulerStateManagerAdaptor SEVERE:  Exception processing future
java.util.concurrent.ExecutionException: java.lang.RuntimeException: Failed to fetch data from path: /heron/executionstate/foo
        at com.google.common.util.concurrent.AbstractFuture$Sync.getValue(AbstractFuture.java:299)
        at com.google.common.util.concurrent.AbstractFuture$Sync.get(AbstractFuture.java:272)
        at com.google.common.util.concurrent.AbstractFuture.get(AbstractFuture.java:96)
        at com.twitter.heron.spi.statemgr.SchedulerStateManagerAdaptor.awaitResult(SchedulerStateManagerAdaptor.java:71)
        at com.twitter.heron.spi.statemgr.SchedulerStateManagerAdaptor.awaitResult(SchedulerStateManagerAdaptor.java:63)
        at com.twitter.heron.spi.statemgr.SchedulerStateManagerAdaptor.getExecutionState(SchedulerStateManagerAdaptor.java:198)
        at com.twitter.heron.scheduler.RuntimeManagerMain.validateRuntimeManage(RuntimeManagerMain.java:351)
        at com.twitter.heron.scheduler.RuntimeManagerMain.manageTopology(RuntimeManagerMain.java:306)
        at com.twitter.heron.scheduler.RuntimeManagerMain.main(RuntimeManagerMain.java:251)
```

This change makes it so the kill command is more robust and will treat
instances where the state does not exist as a no-op and continue its
clean up.

This fixes: https://github.com/twitter/heron/issues/1126

title: Sort containers by id in the UI so they are easier to find
body:
Sorting the containers by the id makes it easier to find a specific container in the UI without having to hunt around by hovering over the boxes. If you know that there is a problem with a component in container 5 you will now be able to easy go straight to it.

Before:
![screen shot 2016-07-18 at 2 32 51 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/509779/16925928/898caf3e-4cf4-11e6-98c6-40dfe956da8e.png)

After:
![screen shot 2016-07-18 at 2 33 59 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/509779/16925960/b237367a-4cf4-11e6-899f-3731a3f512d2.png)

title: Move scheduler specific computation outside packing
body:
Fixes #1073 

This pull request address two issues
1. Currently Aurora scheduler assumes that the Packing algorithm has homogenized all containers and uses the size of first container for requesting containers. It should pick the largest container and use it instead.
2. RoundRobinAlgorithm need not spread the resource requirement of largest container over smaller containers.

title: Add Bazel 0.3.0 support
body:
This PRs adds Bazel 0.3.0 support.

Bazel 0.3.0 removes a lot of files from the Bazel binary in https://github.com/bazelbuild/bazel/commit/d91d047da35511487c4fcce6f5e438ba779a668b#diff-b6d6ae0d41e460758b3217d7fd82094c so we cannot use `@bazel_tools//third_party/...` for `junit`, `mockito` and `joda` any more. This PR just adds them to WORKSPACE as maven_jars to makes the project support both Bazel 0.2.3 and 0.3.0.

repo.description: Apache Heron (Incubating) is a realtime, distributed, fault-tolerant stream processing engine from Twitter

title: Heron native mesos scheduler
body:
Add heron native mesos scheduler and unit tests.
This scheduler aims to help people get started with heron on mesos; it is not for production.
It has a lot of concerns, for instance, not fully fault tolerant, etc.

In this implementation, heron would start the MesosFramework as a background process on the host doing submission, communicate
with mesos master directly and do the actual scheduling. So:
1. It assumes the host for submission is in the same network as mesos cluster.
2. It assumes the heron mesos scheduler is long running.

The heron mesos scheduler would re-schedule any failed executors. But if the heron mesos scheduler fails due to any
unexpected reasons, it would not get recovered and the whole topology would halt.

title: Allow passing properties to SchedulerMain
body:
Currently SchedulerMain accepts only pre-defined command line arguments.
And there are no easy ways to pass custimzed arguments or properties to SchedulerMain,
while IScheduler implementation needs runtime properties generated on client side, i.e. ILauncher.
(Environment variables can be a workaround, though ugly.)

This pull request allows people to pass properties to SchedulerMain via arguments like "-Pproperty=value",
and IScheduler implementation can fetch them from Runtime.schedulerProperties(..).

This pull request adds filename extension.

title: Add java_tests to make adding java unit tests easier
body: This PR adds a Bazel rule `java_tests` to generate `java_test` according to the specified `test_classes`. It reduces a lot of build codes and it's pretty easy to add a new unit test: just add the full class name and there will be a new `java_test` target created automatically. E.g., `com.twitter.heron.common.basics.CommunicatorTest` will have a target named `CommunicatorTest`.

title: Add API doc link, fix broken link.
body:
- Fix broken links introduced by https://github.com/qiuyij/heron/commit/83a50a70c73a6d7e71f46ffbab3c504dec8a0f24.  
  
  Currently there are two broken links on http://twitter.github.io/heron/docs/getting-started/  
  ![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3656079/16604099/a1f7755e-42d6-11e6-88af-efe6fa70722e.png)
  
  The reason link checker does not catch these is that they are external links.
  **The correct way of adding images to website should be putting images under `website/assets/img` instead of linking an external link.**
- Do not format `127.0.0.1:8888` as link  
  Since this will make link checker fail. And it is not always true that when people are reading the website, the tracker is running on their machine, which means there is no point to put a link to `127.0.0.1:8888` there.
- Add link to API doc
  ![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3656079/16604116/d0a28e48-42d6-11e6-8a40-01e725b65466.png)

Change of website after this PR can be previewed at: https://objmagic.ml/heron/

title: Fix corner cases for FileSink.flush
body:
There are two corner cases for `flush`:
- No record has been processed before the first `flush`: it will output "]" to the stdout and close it.
- No record has been processed between two `flush`s: it will write "]" to a closed writer. Currently it's silent as PrintStream always swallows IOException.

This PR fixed `flush` by creating a new file for these corner cases.

title: add some useful information when run async process
body:
in runASyncProcess method:
- add a log for working directory which can help people locate the working directory to debug in some scheduler like yarn scheduler
- add a log file which can help people to find out what happened between pb.start() and the async process started (maybe some system error occurred)

These information will be very useful for people to solve the problem when deploying the multi-node heron cluster.

Extra information: #1010

title: Make task index never negative in simulator's FieldsGrouping
body:
1. Make the task index never be negative
   As "hash % primeNumber + primeNumber" can overflow and be a negative number,
   when primeNumber is greater than Integar.MAX_VALUE/2.
   This PR fixed it to avoid IndexOutOfBoundsException.
2. Add unit tests

This pull request is supplementary for #1014

title: Make taskIndex never be negative
body: As `Math.abs(Integer.MIN_VALUE)` returns a negative value, taskIndex may be negative. This PR fixed it to avoid IndexOutOfBoundsException.

title: Add the command to install libtool for Mac OS X developers
body:
Add `brew install libtool`. The build will fail with the following error without libtool:

```
Executing genrule //config:config-srcs failed: bash failed: error executing command /bin/bash -c ... (remaining 1 argument(s) skipped): com.google.devtools.build.lib.shell.BadExitStatusException: Process exited with status 1.
Preparing the heron build system...please wait

Found GNU Autoconf version 2.69
Found GNU Automake version 1.15

Warning:  libtoolize does not appear to be available.  This means that
the automatic build preparation via autoreconf will probably not work.
Preparing the build by running each step individually, however, should
work and will be done automatically for you if autoreconf fails.

ERROR: Unable to locate GNU Libtool.

ERROR:  To prepare the heron build system from scratch,
        at least version 1.4.2 of GNU Libtool must be installed.

autogen.sh does not need to be run on the same machine that will
run configure or make.  Either the GNU Autotools will need to be installed
or upgraded on this system, or autogen.sh must be run on the source
code on another system and then transferred to here. -- Cheers!
```

body:
There's one extra directory separator before bin/java in the current executor code. One example as follows:

`2016-06-28 23:01:36: Running container_6_kvs_sink_bolt_216 process as /usr/lib/jvm/java-1.8.0-twitter//bin/java -Xmx4672M -Xms4672M .... 31029 31806 heron_internals.yaml`

This PR fixes it and generates java path with exactly one directory separator along the path
